7X76vtzAqY0aCmJkgxBvCg.text: In general, I'm not into sports bars, however, Silky's at Liberty and Evaline has that genuine sports/Irish pub feel to it that's just right. Sitting at the bar is really nice, there are at least 5 TVs to watch your favorite sporting event on-- there is also a shuffle board table and I see groups meeting here for after-work drinks often.  The food is A+ bar food, I love the Reuben sandwich and every night they have some themed drink special night. I think Thursday night is ladies night and on Friday they have free wings from 5-7. The last time I went I watched the U.S. Open Women's Semi-finals and the wings did not disappoint!

zDL14Y3BK-XJ7xj4ITyIUw.text: Awesome wings and they're 50 cents during all Pen's games

IXzzvD5HTFH-SBoIl3krLg.text: This place is great for your standard neighborhood pub food. Time and time again my boyfriend and I try other places along Liberty Ave. since moving to the Bloomfield area. Too many times we've been disappointed and say..."Let's just go to Silky's next time." Recenty that has morphed into just going to Silky's when we want a simple but good meal. Their burgers are very good,  as are the salads, sandwiches and appetizers. And the specials are creative. Certainly it's not five-star dining, or anything remotely gourmet, but for the kind of food they do, they do very, very well. Burgers, sandwiches, salads, basic appetizers. Cozy atmosphere. Gets a little loud on Friday and Saturday nights after 9 or 10 p.m. when the college crowd rolls in, but it's tolerable. Two thumbs up.

pD8VlfErDIBj72wVTLkwag.text: Nice little pub. Good drinks & atmosphere.  Will go back the next time I'm in town.

a8l9szWQNd-afX5mrp1dGw.text: A cute setup for a pub... decorated in British/Irish fare... several tvs all over the bar, with 5 in the center airing 5 different sports events. Enough to keep me entertained even if all I'm doing is drinking by myself... but I'm blessed with good company. There are also strings of lights all over the eaves that makes me feel like it's Christmas. The music selection is a little odd with its random variety - or is that the jukebox's fault?  The food was pretty delish, with good prices for decent portions. I loved the BBQ Turkey and Bacon Sandwich and the Seafood Chowder. The bf also noted that although the Chicken Fettucine isn't on the regular menu, you can still order it. The service can be hit or miss as it does get pretty busy for one waitress in a full bar.  Now I just need to find somebody in Pittsburgh who can mix me a Black Opal.

aJANH9SwxuV2m_bY3leZDQ.text: Comfortable, friendly, affordable.  Nice stop before an evening out.  I need to head there primetime to assess the evening vibe.  Will be back.

9jyFzynKdhj1aQGVe2aQTA.text: Silky's (in Bloomfield) has the best BLT in Pittsburgh! I don't know the exact specs, but with what looks like about a half pound of perfectly crisp-tastic bacon on an appropriately sized bun, this sandwich is a meal.  As a bar, it's just fine -- not great, not too bad. It's packed on game nights and is a nice place to sit outside in summer.

O3cO3dAKUGyYsYyqEElq3Q.text: Stopped in tonight for a late mini-celebration dinner. I had a really really big, pretty decent burger topped with lots of bacon. The bacon is still crunchier than I like it...I don't know if it's the cut or the way they cook it. The waffle fries are seasoned and really yummy. Good selection of beers. I will never try the pasta. Anyone who goes to a bar and eats pasta and thinks it might actually be good or authentic is delusional. I don't really fit in in this place, but there's bacon. And as they say, if you bacon, they will come.

cE2V44ZQNapqCYwWFoZPAA.text: It's a great place to go for happy hour, have a good dinner. Its great for dinner & lunch.

zQ3zVsNL5MbVQ0DSJOxueQ.text: Looking for a friendly, neighborhood place with great food and a wonderful staff ... Silky's on Liberty is your place. Daily specials plus a respectable standard fare means you'll never tire of the menu. Warm nights make the sidewalk tables perfect for socializing and people watching (goodness knows that Bloomfield has its share of characters.) But what really makes this place special is the fabulous folks who work there. Take some time to get to know them. They're fun and interesting! Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Silky's Pub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

0YULVXPw8-xLIv7HagNNXQ.text: Went here after Little Italy Days in Bloomfield.  After buying three beers at the bar, and getting carded, my party of three sat down at a table.  We received no attention from the waitstaff.  When I went back up to the bar to buy another round for my party, I was carded again, by the same bartender with glasses and short hair.  At that point, I was told that I could not buy beers for my party, even though we had all already presented our IDs initially, and that he would need to see everyone's IDs again.  I went back to my table, collected everyone's IDs, and then presented them to the bartender.  He flipped out, and told me to get service from the wait staff.  Meanwhile, the wait staff thought we were being taking care of at the bar.  So rather than waiting to flag down the waitresses, all three of us went up to the bar, presented our IDs.  The bartender who had lashed out at me ignored us completely.  In fact he walked by is several times and  emptied the trash, rather than attend to our order.  Thankfully the other bartender took care of us.  I've been here before, and hadn't had bad experience, but tonight was awful.

yuljWAPwZhvrqMkGmWqPKg.text: The only plus here is the outdoor seating.   The service at Silkys is usually pretty bad to terrible.  I have had no service there for 30+ minutes before, and there were only about 2 other tables.  Its really a bad place to watch most games, I'm not sure why, its just crappy.  The food is all kind of dumpy and gross.  They had good food at one point, but for the last few years its been on the bad side.  I've had burgers there that were god awful, I'm not sure how they were so bad.  They have decent specials sometimes I guess.

Bvo09bjJbgha7gYyFWZZug.text: Pretty good sports bar.  I didn't have any food, but they've got a decent beer selection, and prices and specials are pretty good.  They've got plenty of screens to watch your favorite event(s), and the outdoor seating on the sidewalk is good, too, if you want to escape the sports crowd but still enjoy some of the atmosphere.

_nlNa4_34m6kqEo3ESzsHA.text: Phenomenal bloody mary on a Sunday. Cute bar tender. delightful ghetto dive. I guess I need to get in on these free wings at some point..

y748uFTRP0o4qIynzN58UQ.text: Free wing Fridays... oh yeah.  I don't even like wings usually, but Silky's knows how to cook 'em so they don't taste fatty.  Get a side of Atomic sauce, which is flavorful as well as hot.  I'd buy it by the bottle if I could.  The menu is huge, and everything I've had has been good.  I always get the home fries on the side, which are cooked with onions and fried jalapenos (!).  Great waitresses, too.  Would be five stars if it had decent air conditioning--in the summer, sitting inside is painful.

QN5b_VntlCdXXkGTR7FRYg.text: I'm going to have to completely agree with Jessica M.'s review of Silky's.  It is the closest bar to my house so I check it out whenever I can.  It is as close as I can define a "Sports Pub", with the tvs showing sports, but with the British Pub decor, and not spilling over the brim with sports fans.  They have good solid pub food which is tasty and with big portions.  The food is always above par and I don't ever think I've had something I wouldn't order again.  I even got a grilled cheese and loved it!!  There is a bit of sticker shock, when you see a sandwich for around 8 bucks, but the sides and the taste make up the difference.  They have some good beers on tap, and you can spend a pretty penny, or you can get a pitcher of Yeungling pretty cheap and just  hang out and play shuffleboard if you like.  The atmosphere is good and friendly, and they have tables outside in the summer.  The jukebox does leave many songs to question, but overall it is a good mix.  There is only street parking, but you usually don't have to walk far.  I'm glad this is my neighborhood pub, and I'll be back, so glad it's gone smoke free!

yOPj44VZY_80G-VfLMKmpg.text: I am going with the "A-Ok" rating here, but it is really "only Ok".  I have been to the Squirrel Hill location and have had better experiences.  This was my first visit to the Bloomfield location and was rather underwhelmed.  The place was packed with Friday evening happy hour go-ers, which was fine.  My friend and I were really in search of food rather than drink, though.  We sat at the bar and so it took a while for the bartender (one of two) to take our orders.  It then took approx. 40 minutes for our food to arrive.  I ordered a wrap and my friend ordered a sandwich.  My order was fine, my friend's was nothing close to what she had ordered.  She then had to wait another 20 minutes for the correct sandwich to be delivered.  Of course, we understand that mistakes happen.  However, what was truly frustrating was the fact no one else in the entire bar appeared to be eating (just drinking) with the exception of one table that had ordered one plate of wings.  So, was the kitchen so backed up that it should have taken so long for our food to arrive?  Where they so crazy busy back there that they got confused and prepared the wrong sandwich?  In addition, and I do find this to be an isolated occurance, I was ill for essentially the entire weekend after eating here on a Friday night.  I won't take Silky's off my list entirely because it is close to my house.  My wrap was good and the staff was friendly.  The place was packed and so that says something positive to me.

DGx_K4lRYmJ8gzy30nJdkA.text: i was there again tonight and it was so much better.  I really think the staff was overwhelmed on saturday.  food was good.  silkys has one of the best reubens in town.

YkwvSTWqF89397x_U1jBJg.text: Captain's Log Stardate: Circa 2004 - 2006-ish... I lived about an hour and a half outside of the city. Coming here was usually pretty exciting. (Here as in the city, not Silky's.) I had a friend who lived here in the East End and on the street I reside on now.   Several times we found ourselves at Silky's Pub. I love the corner building, the way it looks out onto Liberty Ave. It looks so welcoming. Especially in the summer. Outdoor seating, always pretty well packed with people.  I'll come right out and say that the crowd that frequents Silky's isn't my usual crowd, but unlike some bars I'd never had an issue with someone wanting to start a fight with us because we look like a bunch of dirty malcontents. This place is just not our usual dive bar.  Thursday night my boyfriend texted me that he was there with a mutual friend. Living less than a city block from there I headed over. I needed a beer and some hockey/world series action to distract me after the Halloween parade. It was as busy as usual. A few seats remaining and I managed to snag one right at the bar, front and center.  I hate to say this because I don't remember this happening years ago when I went there. I was not even acknowledged. I get flagging down a bartender in a crazy busy bar in the South Side on a Friday night. I don't like it but I get it. This was a moderately steady Thursday night. I wasn't standing behind the people's sitting at the bar. I was the person sitting at the bar. There were two male bartenders both bartenders asked the guy next to me multiple times if he wanted anything else to drink.   By "multiple times" I mean 6 or 8 times. The person sitting directly beside me. They wouldn't look at me. I tried to make eye contact with either of them and it was as if I wasn't even there. Eventually the boyfriend's beer emptied as well. This is about 20 minutes after I arrived. I've had people walk in and stand behind us and the bar tender or waitress was on them immediately. After another 5 minutes of the boyfriend's beer being perched precariously on the edge of the bar and the bartenders standing there chatting he had to ask the bartender for a refill and if I could have a drink.  The bartender looks up at him, grabs his pint glass angrily from the bar and says, "Oh, you wanted another?"   Really? I was so angry at that point that it took everything I had not to ask the guy what his issue was.  I later saw him drop a pint glass and stumble into something so many he was drunk.  The food that other people ordered smelled and looked great. Even the seafoody bits which I normally hate smelling. The tv's are plentiful and newer. I just don't know if I'll ever get to go back and try the food as I hate being slighted by a business owner and treated as if my business isn't appreciated.

rf9Hp7vjCgLOk9S78JVu7g.text: This is one of the coolest laid back bars to go to. It draws a little bit of an older crowd, so the atmosphere is chill and fun and provides a really good time. I'm a huge fan of drinking beers with friends and throwing darts, and with a few dart boards and a shuffleboard to boot this place is perfect. I've had food here a couple of times as well, and for bar food it's actually quite good. The location is perfect for sitting out on the tables right on Liberty and chatting with buddies as the cars go by.

t3gyJJr89iqutPdfiRrs5A.text: Great place.  Nice service.  Good beer.  Outdoor seating.  Nice pub food.   Definately recommend.

3aozkaXNQX4Cpbah3JqoTw.text: Out of my three day, 3 state bar crawl this was my favorite bar. Service was good, the beer selection wasnt amazing but okay, and they had shuffle board. But what sold me was the Silky's had that homey feel to it.

photos.caption: Photo of Silky's Pub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bathroom art is min

f7vQYYudvgBBhJV33QaCNQ.text: Huge portions of delicious American pub grub. The prices are reasonable, the food is tasty, and the service at the bar is always professional. Don't come here expecting fast food, it's all made fresh and is of good quality.

THIQhC2EWpFevtRqyO72Kw.text: Great, cozy place to grab a beer and watch a game! They have pretty good food with reasonable pricing. I really like the chicken pesto sandwich!  The service isn't the best but if you're really into watching a game its less noticeable lol! I do prefer the Squirrel Hill location over Bloomfield. Both have on street parking, but in bloomfield its easier to find parking.   All and all this is one of my favorite sports bars!

4s_P0EH1N-U_Nbh0lEjq1Q.text: OMG, the wings. They are double-fried and soooo crispy. I have not had such awesome wings in a long time! Otherwise, pretty typical pub-ish food and atmosphere. Great local place with the sports games on in surround sound!

Vj2kOGcgBe7Hh932osny2g.text: good place for a quick Guinness, or grab a patio seat  food is good, their Rachael is worth ordering (to-go especially)  A good neighborhood joint!

qHpttorIOqsDVJ5b7ouw-A.text: They have an amazing on tap beer selection. Several small tvs. But if the Steelers aren't playing, they have old school pop music as the background noise, instead of another football game. I'm sure it's up to the bartender, but it just made for a weird vibe.

ITZ0HbKi26UUt3hBqbotjQ.text: Excellent food! Excellent service! I would highly recommend this place to anyone who wants a great meal with great service.

JGr2gZF1kGqhlRaRW4Ma1w.text: I've been to all 3 Silky's locations and this is my favorite. The food is great, the service is warm, and the environment is comfortable and welcoming.

03r_3hG91_hgiBHu7m7HJQ.text: Stopped by on a lazy Sunday afternoon for lunch.  French onion soup was delicious, steak salad was amazing as the steak was cooked ad seasoned perfectly, husband enjoyed his Rachel and the burger was also enjoyed.  Def give it a taste if you're in the neighborhood.

1dyjkpwmAH6U8idk_73ADg.text: I started out really disliking the food at Silky's...especially where there are better 'bar food' options within a mile.    But, they've won me over.  A little bit.  I'll call them average.  Wings - still underwhelmed.  They are a dry rub (unless you get a bbq).  And usually overcooked.  I like my wings well done, but these are always so average - I don't even order them here anymore.  Burgers and Sandwiches are pretty good.  Buffalo chicken wrap was solid.  Burger (off the special menu) got the job done.  Waffle fries - very good.  I think because they are very crispy.  Based on the bacon reviews below - i think the general rule is they are good at frying the hell out of something...sometimes for good - sometimes for bad.  What redeems this place beyond the average food - is the layout and outdoor seating.  It beats other bloomfield bars given it's greater amount of seating and better views of tv screens.  Also, it has the most outdoor seating.  Not tons - but if you get there at a decent hour - still possible to get a table.  Silky's usually makes the list to watch a game or if weather calls for outdoor drinking.

qtIc4ul-d55k6wWVDNeGFw.text: Over the years Silky's or The 'Chester as my friends and I call it (from Shaun of the Dead) has become our go to bar.  This is for few reasons. 1.  The atmosphere and staff are exactly what we look for in a place.  Silky's balances the line between trendy, divy, and sporty all at once and actually pulls it off.  They have a few TVs which always is showing the big game and usually has good specials during Penguin and Steeler games. Silky's also boasts a shuffleboard table and darts to keep people busy and having fun.  The shuffleboard is a must to try. 2.  The beer and food are grade A bar quality.  Nothing pretentious here, just good wings, a huge burger, and unique selections.  The beer list isn't huge, but they do carry a few microbrews and some of the local swill.   3.  No smoking.   Silky's in Bloomfield also has plenty of tables and bar stools and isn't over run with drunk yinzers it attracts a mix of college students, young professionals, and old dudes from the Bloomfield area.    If you're searching for a new bar to have some food, play some games, and drink a beer look no further than The 'Chester.

4gJPIc63uQljC8Uk-ldBhQ.text: A solid neighborhood bar, just a short walk from my workplace.  My coworkers and I went out here after work.  It's a nice little cozy environment that just has a comforting feel to it.  Plenty of flat screen TVs to catch the big game, though not sure what their channel options are for out of town games.  I'd have to go back to investigate.  Otherwise, the service was solid, the drink menu was decent, and the food was good.  I had the nachos which were pretty average to slightly above average in nature.  The guacamole was actually good though.  Nothing to write home about, but decent enough to enjoy.  And yes, I'm a stickler when it comes to guac.  Overall, I'm giving this place 4 stars because this is simply a cool place to chill after a long day at work.  Give it a try and see what you think.

X_gbc9WZtvMBwk8zzuKihA.text: Incredible drink specials, great atmosphere, and delicious food.  You can't really go wrong there.  They have daily specials and awesome beers on tap.  The pricing is reasonable, for both food and drink.  Non smoking inside, but easy access to smoking outside.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  The jukebox isn't bad.  All in all I was pleasantly suprised with how much I actually enjoyed this place.  I was a little leary at first, as I kept associating it with Silky's the strup bar in McKees Rocks.

V5uM3VLK_4pdeiAtXQ_8-Q.text: We had heard good things about this little neighborhood bar, good beer selection (check), cheerful service (check), good prices on drinks (check), and food (check), and supposedly good food.  The only problem that our party of 6 had was the way the place was set up, they don't allow smoking inside but they should of. All of the smokers were standing outside in front of a giant sliding, garage style door and all of the smoke was sucked back into the bar.   All of us agreed this is the worst place we have been in for smoke and some of our group were smokers, they didn't even like it. So if your idea is to sit inside a smokey hazy bar you will love it, but to sit in that atmosphere and dine was impossible. We left for cleaner air.

yk9j7MqYOJnOfJgXE4CYNw.text: We live a block away and decided to try Silkys one last time with the kids in tow. The waitress was great, food was great and they kept the volume on the jukebox to a reasonable level for 6-7 pm in the evening.  Have had issues with all 3 things on multiple recent (last year or so) visits, and the last time had an issue with all three. I am glad to see things were much better this time as we enjoy supporting this place and it is very walkable for us. Thanks Silky's!

J_anLhBQPN-48L1W4xNGSg.text: Living in South Side almost ruined my love of sports bars -- all I want is a place to watch a game and enjoy some fried food and drinks, without sloppy drunk girls spilling beers on me. Thankfully, my friends took me to Silky's and reminded me that it's worth it to cross the river now and then for a drink.   The bar food is quality -- I highly recommend the fried zucchini. There's also the Munchies Platter, with provolone sticks, onion rings, chicken wings. It is so massive, my arteries almost went on strike. Crowd is good company, bathrooms are surprisingly clean, and there's about five TVs for your viewing pleasure. If I lived in Bloomfield, I'd definitely be more of a regular.

-NxCO08r5T1eimq19aZq7g.text: Got into area late on a Sunday evening, after a bad travel day. The kitchen was closed, but the bartender hooked me up with some good pretzels, sliced Swiss cheese and a cold beer.

bbq9-Y-5mPQycrdCEnw52Q.text: Wasn't overly impressed with the place. The drinks were really expensive. The food was ok with the limited menu but pricey as well. They had an October fest German style feast as a special but the potato pancakes were straight from ore Ida in the giant eagle freezer section. Very disappointed there. Not one sandwich under 10$ but maybe that's the going rate over that way. And one last thing, There's no parking at all which is more than likely common in Bloomfield but it's something to think about. Usually there's parking in front but there's none at this place or even across the street.

2QhaTSycStFr3CT9z62OEQ.text: After walking by probably 30 times and wondering what the happy clientele inside were enjoying we finally made a date to come in and test out the burgers. We had heard good things in the neighborhood so we came in around 500 on a Thursday, put in the order and it was about an hour until the burgers came out. We were asked how we wanted the burgers cooked but they came out "done af" but after an hour how else would they have come out, food ended up just being middle of the road especially for Liberty Ave. The waitress was nice and had to work the whole floor herself while constantly reminding the bartender she had drink tickets that needed filled. Will probably come back for pens games and beers, maybe not for a sit down meal.

Dn19_kWggmaG1TUrfxwEnA.text: I was staying at a hotel nearby and was looking for a place close by for some food and drinks.  The hotel recommended heading down to Walnut street, but that seemed like a long walk.  I checked Yelp and saw that this place had some decent reviews, so thought I would give it a try.  There weren't too many people there when I walked in, so I went right up and sat at the bar.  I was greeted right away by the bartender (Bill).  He told me which three beers he was out of (which unfortunately were the three best ones on draft), then took my order.  I started with some wings and a beer.  I only order a half dozen of the atomic flavored wings which was unfortunate, as they were some of the best wings I've had in quite a while.  As a comparison, they weren't as hot as Buffalo Wild Wings 'hot' wings, but had decent heat and great flavor.  I then had another beer and ordered a meal they had on special.  It's not what I would call bar food by any means, as it was a perfectly cooked baked chicken with vegetables and potatoes.  I got a cup of cheddar and lager soup as part of the meal too which was wonderful.  Overall, I was glad to stumble across this place.  As others mentioned, it seemed to tailor to an older crowd (30-49 seemed to be the median age when I was there).  I would have given it 5 stars had they been fully stocked on their draft beer.  I like to drink unique or uncommon beers when traveling and had to settle for Molson that night.

photos.caption: Photo of Silky's Pub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ordered the special tonight. It was wonderful.

hfbdUeTLVj0JCqqt_x3lxg.text: I enjoy Silkys, usually have good service and am usually satisfied with my food. This time my chicken on my salad seemed way overcooked...just some of it though...almost as if 2 chicken breasts had been used, one fresh, one not so much. Still tasty, just not as good as usual.

xN-gjdt0wE7xG8QJ6ngM9g.text: Late night starving, need something to eat, go to Yelp, says silkys is open for another 45 min.  Get dressed walk down from my hotel and they are closed!  Nothing to eat now!

Mk4PeMLV3UEOA_7785V-Cg.text: Silky's is my go to spot for a laid-back Friday night where you can have a few drinks and play some shuffle board without a crazy crowd. The place is never empty, but it's also never too full where you can't get a table. The crowd is a mixed bag, but like many bars in Pittsburgh, I've never felt out of place there.  Silky's has a slightly above average tap list that often includes Southern Tier, Fat Heads, or Great Lakes. I have been disappointed several times when the tap list has changed but not the menu. I get my heart set on a beer, only to find out the keg has been tapped. No complaints though, there is always something else to try.   I haven't had much food here, but the waffles fries are a great candidate for a late night bite.  Silky's has several dart boards, and a shuffle board table along the window. If you get here early enough, you can get in a few shuffle board games before someone else takes a turn.   When the weather is nice, the patio is a great option. There's potential for good people watching on Liberty Ave most days. However, asthmatics be forewarned, the bar is non-smoking, but the patio is not.

AiMqb3bdXHfv7lERrnIWjw.text: Just there last evening after a 12 hour shift at work. ordered a Rachel sandwhich...received a reuben. The server apologized and offered to get the correct sandwhich for me to go. She brought it to the table packaged to go. I drove all the way home to moon township opened my container and found another reuben sandwhich.....disappointing to say the least.  The fries were great however.

photos.caption: Photo of Silky's Pub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. reuben

pPxDSpKrVNH65MTw5exiAQ.text: Ok. Walkable from where we were staying for one night. (It was closest). Got decent Yelp reviews, had eclectic crowd, so we went for it. Only 1 waitress, place 1/4 full, so we thought we'd get apps, 2 drinks and on to the next.  Oops. 25 min wait on apps. And don't bite on the extra $4 for chicken on nachos. You should get a prize for finding any.  Bottom line is... Keep going up the block. Meh.

5PV0_ca8rn2AedM4Tc1SKw.text: I really like Silky's- it's a great little bar with a good two list. Last time I was there the southern tier 2xipa was on. So. Good. I had the Reuben and was so happy with it.  Crispy buttery bread with corned beef and sauerkraut. The fries on the side were crispy and soft in the middle. I'll be back!

YV42v0UShGZmivGcGb4sNQ.text: I don't end up here often, but when I do, I'm never disappointed. Silky's Bloomfield has a great rotating selection of draft beers and their menu is surprisingly tasty. I say surprisingly, not because anything about the place would indicate otherwise, but simply because when a place feels more like a bar then a restaurant, I anticipate that I'll be served basic bar food.   On the contrary, Silky's burgers are delicious and they have some non-standard fare like the Stuffed Peppers that are always crowd pleasers.   The Bloomfield location has the additional benefit of some nice outdoor seating on the quieter end of Liberty Ave., indoor shuffleboard, good sports watching TVs, and a jukebox.  There are lots of bars to choose from in Bloomfield, but Silky's makes a strong play to be your go-to neighborhood hangout.

iD_ot4txe_iG_8tMJcGsgw.text: SIlkys is pretty sweet. The french onion soup and new england clam chowder are delish.  Beers are on the pricier end but its no dive bar so that's to be expected. They do have drink specials sometimes but never when I'm there, idk if its weird times or I just aways go out late or what but i always miss em. I usually get the soup and salad combo when I go, the salads are huge and the combo of flavors like steak gorgonzola and pecans is so good! Plus in the summer you can sit outside with your dog.

kYnxav1F0ZbYcqe_93oOog.text: Sad, but True. First time and last time here. Got there, thought it would be nice. Not much of a beer selection, and expensive. Asked for two waters after we got our drinks and the server was more concerned with chatting with others rather than helping us. Took about 10 minutes to get waters. Two drinks and two shots came to about 30.00. That is ridiculous for a corner bar in Pittsburgh, especially for the shitty service and small TVs.

ltXDfBritvBVnMJnMzBrvA.text: Everything you would want in a pub type establishment.  Several draughts on tap, delicious food, and friendly, attentive staff.  I was visiting Pittsburgh and was looking for a place to have a beer, some food, and to watch the MLB Wildcard playoff. After stopping in at two other places we headed to Silkys, and so glad we did. Several TVs playing both the Penguins and the Mets/Giants.  I ordered the Silkys burger and my friend ordered a Buffalo Wing Perogie.  Both were exceptional.  Would definitely recommend this place for the food, service, beer, and sports.

9-JN-Pd2eopNvQYRBa8iUg.text: This is a great place. Love the neighborhood pub vibe. The bartenders are great and very friendly and attentive. I've had wings at a lot of places in Pittsburgh and the wings at Silky's are some of my favorite. Just the right ratio of crispiness and tenderness. I don't come here often because its a little out of the way for me but I never had anything but a really nice experience.

X-8l6G8mHQDv9O0q25JLGg.text: My 2nd city.  And one of my favourite sports bars.  TVs everywhere, great beer selection from the locals like East End to the harder to find in bars like Lagunitas.  Oh and shuffleboard.  As far as I'm concerned no greater drinkin game.  Write that down .

y-nIyBerXq4Z60jVlc44mQ.text: The only bad thing I can say is that the calamari rings need more sauce and more spice.  The greens and feta on flat bread was delicious but the flat bread is plain, limp and superfluous.  The burgers are large and covered in goodness. I asked for bacon instead of ham and I was rewarded with a fistful of mana atop my hand formed patty. The egg was a little over cooked and did not drip as I'd hoped.  The beer selection is good.  The TV's are a plenty.

xo0vmcBvZ8yzHR5FaEm8-w.text: My experience here was terrible. A 15 minute wait for a draft beer on a slow night? No thanks.

a66veA8KztF2pPdO6mNeiw.text: Not impressed. Went there with a group of friends for dinner. I ordered the special, BBQ chicken tacos and tater tots. It took forever for our appetizer and food to come out to the table. My tacos were so soggy I couldn't pick the second one up, i ate it with a fork. The juice from the tacos also made the tater tots extremely soggy.  Everyone else in my group was disappointed in some way with our visit.

NduY8XfFwHzLn6V-sAPtMA.text: I came here for dinner with some friends the other night and it was pretty fun. It was really quiet when we got there and there weren't too many people. It wasn't crowded at all... surprisingly.   We all tried their pumpkin spice martini which is OUT OF THIS WORLD! I highly recommend it to everyone. It is so good!   The food on the other hand is just your standard pub fare. It doesn't taste particularly better than any food you'd get at any other pub. It was just okay. I had a buffalo chicken wrap which was good.   Our waitress was on top of things which was nice, but then again, how could you not be on a slow night without many tables right?   Anyway, we had a fun time here. As for the food, I probably wouldn't go back JUST for the food. If I were meeting  a group of people here, I'd definitely come back, but on my own, maybe not.

dXU-51jJJkodctSNYfYuGQ.text: We came in on a Wednesday night and found a good local crowd. It's our first time and we were a bit confused as to whether it was seat yourself or wait for a table. We meandered our way in and found started to look for a table and look at the beer list when a waitress greeted us and ask if we wanted a table or bar seating. We settled on a comfy high top and ordered drinks. Alas, the craft draft list was only IPAs. Blast, but we'll do.  For food, I ordered the Crow's Nest crab cake bites, which came with fries and coleslaw. Hubs got the taco salad. The food arrived and portions are large. Unfortunately, my food was barely warm. It tasted as though it had been ready long before it arrived to the table. Hub's salad was standard pub fare, though no dressing required.  The vibe is neighborhoody. It was nice out, so they left the doors open which gave it a nice breeze. Music is strange as it was very eclectic. Overall, it's good service, nice atmosphere, though food is average.

photos.caption: Photo of Silky's Pub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crow&#39;s Nest crab cake bites

_P6GVPrQLdyOwIn8y9GoIw.text: I love Silky's - it's a great place to stop in Bloomfield. It's like a secret spot, but they have great food and a good happy hour. Perfect for watching a Pens game or grabbing a drink with friends. They have great selection of draft beers and wines.   We ended up going to Silky's around 6:30pm on a Saturday night. To start - we ordered drinks from the bar, and you get a jar of pretzel sticks to eat. Perfect for snacking.   Next up, I ordered the delicious clam chowder- I always grab a bowl, but it is that good. For appetizer - we split the mozzarella sticks - they were also very good.   For my entree, I ordered the buffalo chicken wrap with the waffle fries. It was so good. They also have the most delicious ranch dressing.   Heads up - sometimes the service can be slow, but the food is always worth.

photos.caption: Photo of Silky's Pub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Silky's Pub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Silky's Pub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

In06cul1B0i5v_XsHR3s4A.text: Went to this establishment with my husband. A random guy sat next to us and offered to buy us drinks. The bartender decided on his own to charge us for drinks we didn't even order. I tried to explain the situation to him but he was a complete shit show. The guy did cover the drinks as planned but this guy needs to be fired immediately. You never tell a guest they are wrong, even if they are! In this case I wasn't.

8sM-yWvGlYJDuagUMMJ4Cw.text: Silky's is a nice neighborhood establishment with a diverse crowd. Nice beer selection and tasty basic bar food. Well done, folks! Delicious Sunday brunch and 22 ounce Bloody Mary specials.

photos.caption: Photo of Silky's Pub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bloody Mary hits the spot.
Photo of Silky's Pub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Three pepper cheddar soup.

Iil-1bxBgR2JNhWZBNhz9g.text: Walk past here everyday for two years coming home from work, finally had our first time in, came for dinner. Ordered 6 wings, so delicious! Huge portion size, very good sized wings. Everything was super incredibly clean, bathroom and what we could see of the kitchen, tables, pinball machine. Very happy with the prices too. Friendly and attentive service. My boyfriend got the crab cakes and I had a bite, so delicious! Also the hidden pinball machine in the back is important because we love pinball and seek out places we know has one. We will be back :)

QXiOsbdYwxX3jbGgOpZ1Mg.text: Great little bar that's tucked away. Awesome Buffalo Chicken Wrap.

MEme72T64v033xSRL0HNZw.text: We walked in here on a whim as we had just checked in to a hotel down the street.   Great little corner bar with seating outside   Plenty of beers in tap and and a full bar available.   We sat at the bar around 10pm and it was not crowded but not empty. By 11:30 it was packed and hopping. A great little scene.   The food was good  I had a Ruben and garlic fries Prices were very reasonable

uIfGts290mSO4b_grfig4g.text: I recently planned an event at Silky's that went off without a hitch.   Bill, Katie, Steph, and Logan are True professionals that kept the drinks and the food coming!   The company also enjoyed some shuffleboard while we were there.   It was perfect! Thank you again Silky's!!!

vqLjrfDJ0QDBf7gzEjwNvw.text: I'm here from out of town staying at the Courtyard Marriott. The hotel recommended this place as it was close by. Well, I should have walked a bit further. The beer was cold but that was the highlight of my visit. The food was mediocre, I ordered the crab cakes. It needed salt and pepper, and of course it wasn't on the table. I had to ask for it. Which, in it of itself, isn't a bad thing, except that the service was horrible. After I walked in it took forever to get the waitress' attention. She was busy talking to another server. The bartender had to approach her and even after that it took forever. She didn't offer me water and was just nowhere to be seen.  I will never come here again. It's August 21, 2018, 9 pm.

M1MEzidHGU9ZuhezRWmrwg.text: They have started accepting credit cards again! Hooray! See my previous review - my only major complaint was this silly cash only thing they tried. Now we're back to normal and all is well. Get the wings!

photos.caption: Photo of Silky's Pub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Their new sunday brunch menu!
Photo of Silky's Pub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu pt 1

4tMghWifNNcDvXfHSGtd6A.text: Meh. I've gone to Silky's a few times over the years, because I was in the area but not a destination spot.  Drinks: Drafts and the basics.  Food: Hit or miss. I usually opt for a cocktail. The last experience-  My chicken wings were the size of turkey wings. Bigger is not better. Nah.  Atmosphere: Neighborhood bar. Jukebox. Some sort of pool table etc.  Few outdoor seats on Liberty.  Ok for a game or few drinks passing through.   I would suggest updating the menu.

uKBzyZp9Ht7pD0KYLnmHhg.text: This place is just as good as I remember it being in college.  Excellent beer list ... all good choices.  Food is surprisingly good for a corner bar too. Burgers are hand-made and never disappoint. We do not have real home-towny kinda' bars that serve food this good in the DC area. It's a shame.  Always a pleasure.  Well, except for the creepy old guy who hogs the shuffleboard table and talks to himself. But every bar has its quirks.

5g-tWKlRXPMvQvOpvjdivA.text: I went to Silky's with my sister and her roommates the other day and we had a great time! It was pretty empty, but it was a Sunday. I'm visiting from NYC so the drink prices seemed amazing to me ($4-5 a beer), but I'm not sure how it compares to the rest of Pittsburgh.   PLUS they had shuffleboard so we all got to show off our mad skills/luck. We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Silky's Pub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shuffleboard!

eAflstKCG7bvG3y1Px78yQ.text: I've been to both Silkies once, and I'd have to say, I was pretty impressed each time.   The food here was good, the service was great and friendly (it was dead though, so I'll have to come back when it's busy), the portions were large, and the price point great. Also, the presentation of the food is better than I expected for a laid back pub. The only thing I wasn't a huge fan of was the cole slaw. It wasn't bad, I just feel like it could have been better, it was a bit bland.   Either way, I enjoyed my meal. I got the bang bang burger which was a special. It has a spicy sauce on top, and it was perfectly cooked medium as I requested.  My friend got a chicken bacon cheddar wrap which was good, and the waffle fries were on point. Nice and crispy.  Oh, and the ranch is bomb! Bad ranch just kills my meal, so that was nice.   Other than that, they have a great bar space with TVs. I'll be going back here!

photos.caption: Photo of Silky's Pub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Part of the bar
Photo of Silky's Pub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Perfectly quiet afternoon
Photo of Silky's Pub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bang bang burger

KOd5P6kPBzkhepa5aOkE4w.text: I really want this place to be my casual neighborhood bar, but its inconsistent hours make that difficult. It was recently closed on a Saturday midday...why? The food is solid, the beer selection good, and, while not overly generous, they don't short you on a pour of booze in your G&T or other basic cocktail. Staff has been friendly, though sometimes too few for the number of patrons.

RLEpAx0iGzsBjpIcjgFoKQ.text: Just in town for a day but glad I found this place.  Local pub but found out they have good food and atmosphere!!   I came in around 4:30 and it was quiet but apparently they have shuffle board and get busy ding penguins/Steelers games.  I can definitely see this being a frequent place to come if I lived here.  Also, cheap public parking across the street.

lQ5UJh_xfYCDX7TV72wLRQ.text: Went to Silkys tonight and sat outside. No waitress came out for over 10 minutes. Became frustrated and went inside and ordered 2 beers and food. Waitress never checks on us. 30 minutes pass...no food. 45 minutes pass...no food. 50 minutes pass...still no food. Got up to leave and asked the bartender about our order and they appeared dumbfounded. I'm upset about the service as I've been to Silky's numerous times and always enjoyed their food. Won't be going back anytime soon.

XAXfQqkcqHYqkXSQEHWpsA.text: I live nearby seasonally for the last 2 years and Silky's is my go to spot. Good people, great prices on beer, and the buffalo chicken wrap is amazing. Love this place. It's a neighborhood bar that has good food. Curb those expectations folks

Fi6pbWLHoX6kLM1vAyFbCw.text: The menu is a problem, everything on it sounds so good! Last night, after much deliberation over a couple of pints of the amazing Ithaca Apricot Wheat beer, I opted for the Bleu Burger. A burger stuffed with blue cheese and mashed olives. It was outstanding. Like when you wake up craving the food you ate last night, that good. Can't wait to go back and try the rest of the menu.

Q8akajmIUyucsfdLn_EV3A.text: Until a few weeks ago the only time I'd been to Silky's was on a terrible date...he was a messy eater and generally ruined any good impression the place could have made on me. All that changed when my boyfriend and I decided to check it out for Sunday dinner one evening. We were very hungry and seeking a nice little neighborhood pub sort of place near our new house. I'm happy to say Silky's ended up being just what we were hoping to find!  It was dark and sort of cozy-feeling inside when we walked in. I liked how chill the vibe was. We immediately seated ourselves at a table to wait for the server. This might be a random observation, but I really appreciated the size of the tables for two. They could have probably fit four people but with only two seats it felt like there was actually enough room for plates and drinks and such. One of my biggest annoyances with eating at bars is getting an extraordinarily small, wobbly table. Our waitress came over pretty quickly and provided us with the draft list and specials for the night. The beer choices weren't amazing but certainly adequate for a neighborhood place. I ended up ordering the California chicken wrap with regular fries, and my boyfriend got chicken fingers with waffle fries. I absolutely loved my wrap and fully intend to order it again! It had guacamole, (an all too rare thing to find in wraps or sandwiches in Pittsburgh) bacon, general chunks of grilled chicken, and tomatoes. Those are four of my favorite foods, so I was very pleased with my choice. I eat my wraps with a knife and fork so I had no trouble with the messiness factor, but the wrap was quite large and I had leftovers for the following day. I enjoyed my boyfriend's waffle fries a little more than my plain ones however, so I'll probably get those next time. He said his chicken fingers were great. I'm sure we'll be back at Silky's very soon. Delicious food, awesome service, and close proximity to our home will make this a regular spot for the two of us.
